question_text: Which type of laptop battery can be removed and replaced by the user without tools?
correct_answer: Modular battery
explanation: Modular batteries are designed for easy user access and replacement.

question_text: What is a common sign that a laptop battery is modular?
answer_options: Battery pops out using a latch or button
Battery requires BIOS update to remove
correct_answer: Battery pops out using a latch or button
explanation: Modular batteries often have latches for easy removal and replacement.

question_text: Select TWO features of modular laptop batteries.
answer_options: Can be removed without opening the laptop
Require a soldering iron to disconnect
Can be swapped using a latch or button
correct_answer: Can be removed without opening the laptop
Can be swapped using a latch or button
explanation: Modular batteries are externally accessible and don't require disassembly.

question_text: Which of the following apply to modular batteries? (Select all that apply)
correct_answer: User-replaceable
Accessible via latch or button
explanation: Soldered batteries are not modular; modular batteries are made to be removed easily.

question_text: A customer brings in a laptop with a non-removable battery that is no longer holding a charge. Which of the following is the best course of action?
answer_options: Tell the customer to press the battery eject button
Open the laptop and replace the internal battery
Use BIOS settings to disable battery lockout
Advise the customer to replace the entire motherboard
correct_answer: Open the laptop and replace the internal battery
explanation: Non-removable (internal) batteries require opening the laptop for replacement.

question_text: Which of these laptop battery designs is MOST likely to require a technician for replacement?
correct_answer: Soldered-in battery
explanation: Soldered-in/internal batteries cannot be removed by the user and usually require a technician.

question_text: Select TWO valid reasons manufacturers might choose a non-modular battery design.
correct_answer: To improve laptop thinness
To discourage user tampering
explanation: Non-removable designs are often used to minimize size and reduce tampering risks.

question_text: A repair technician is evaluating two laptops. One has a battery that is secured with internal screws and requires disassembly to access. The other has a battery with external latches. What is the key difference in these battery designs?
answer_options: One uses a lithium-ion cell and the other does not
One is a modular battery and the other is internal
One supports USB charging and the other does not
Both require specialized tools for battery replacement
correct_answer: One is a modular battery and the other is internal
explanation: Modular batteries are designed for external access; internal batteries require disassembly.

question_text: A technician is tasked with replacing a non-modular laptop battery. Which TWO challenges are most likely during this process?
answer_options: Accessing the battery through the case housing
Disconnecting a latch on the battery exterior
Dealing with adhesive or screws inside the chassis
Locating the BIOS switch to release the battery
correct_answer: Accessing the battery through the case housing
Dealing with adhesive or screws inside the chassis
explanation: Internal battery replacement usually involves disassembly and internal fasteners or adhesive.

question_text: Which of the following describe likely characteristics of a non-removable laptop battery? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: Requires opening the chassis to access
May be glued or screwed into place
Can be quickly ejected by the user
correct_answer: Requires opening the chassis to access
May be glued or screwed into place
explanation: Only modular batteries allow fast user access; internal ones require disassembly.

question_text: Which laptop battery type does NOT suffer from the 'memory effect'?
correct_answer: Lithium Ion (Li-ion)

question_text: Why is it important to use the exact battery model specified for your laptop?
answer_options: Laptop batteries are universal in size
Battery form factors vary by manufacturer and model
All batteries use the same voltage
You can swap in any smartphone battery
correct_answer: Battery form factors vary by manufacturer and model

question_text: Which of the following are types of modern laptop batteries? (Select all that apply)
correct_answer: Li-ion
LiPo
Lithium polymer

question_text: A laptop battery is labeled as 'LiPo.' Compared to traditional Li-ion batteries, what is one advantage it offers?
correct_answer: Flexible and lightweight design

question_text: Select two advantages of lithium-ion (Li-ion) laptop batteries.
answer_options: They do not suffer from memory effect
They are commonly used in CRT monitors
correct_answer: They do not suffer from memory effect
They are lightweight

question_text: Which of the following is a key reason why laptop batteries are not interchangeable between models?
answer_options: All laptop batteries use different chemical compositions
Each laptop model uses a unique form factor
correct_answer: Each laptop model uses a unique form factor

question_text: What characteristic of lithium-ion batteries makes them safer than older battery technologies, despite potential thermal risks?
answer_options: They contain a gel electrolyte that cannot overheat
They feature built-in microcontrollers to regulate charge
They have a lower energy density than NiMH
They operate at sub-volt levels to prevent discharge
correct_answer: They feature built-in microcontrollers to regulate charge

question_text: Select all statements that are true about LiPo (Lithium Polymer) batteries used in laptops.
answer_options: They are lighter than traditional Li-ion batteries
They use a solid or gel-like electrolyte
They always provide longer battery life than Li-ion
They can be molded into custom shapes
They are immune to swelling or puncture damage
correct_answer: They are lighter than traditional Li-ion batteries
They use a solid or gel-like electrolyte
They can be molded into custom shapes

question_text: Select two challenges related to laptop battery form factors.
answer_options: Most laptops share a standardized battery shape
Even minor physical differences can cause fit issues
Batteries can only be installed by certified technicians
Form factor variations impact replacement part availability
All batteries are designed to match USB-C port orientation
correct_answer: Even minor physical differences can cause fit issues
Form factor variations impact replacement part availability

question_text: What typically holds a laptop keyboard in place and must be removed first during replacement?
correct_answer: Bezel and screws

question_text: What type of cable typically connects a laptop keyboard to the system board?
correct_answer: Ribbon cable

question_text: If a laptop keyboard fails but the laptop is otherwise working, what is a quick way to continue using it?
answer_options: Reboot the device in safe mode
correct_answer: Use an external USB keyboard

question_text: What must you do before detaching a laptop's ribbon cable during a keyboard replacement?
answer_options: Disconnect the battery and open the cable lock mechanism
correct_answer: Disconnect the battery and open the cable lock mechanism

question_text: Select two typical steps involved in replacing an internal laptop keyboard.
correct_answer: Disconnecting the ribbon cable
Removing screws and bezel

question_text: Which of the following is a reason to temporarily connect an external USB keyboard to a laptop?
answer_options: To avoid using touch screen controls
To test functionality when the internal keyboard is nonresponsive
To enter BIOS without powering on
correct_answer: To test functionality when the internal keyboard is nonresponsive

question_text: During a keyboard replacement, what is the primary function of the ZIF (Zero Insertion Force) connector found on many laptop motherboards?
answer_options: It converts analog keystrokes to digital signals
It prevents short circuits during installation
It locks the ribbon cable in place without excessive force
It regulates power to the keyboard backlight
correct_answer: It locks the ribbon cable in place without excessive force

question_text: Which of the following are valid considerations when performing a keyboard swap on a laptop? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: Sourcing the correct keyboard layout and model
Avoiding ribbon cable crimping during installation
Removing the hard drive to access the keyboard port
Replacing thermal paste on the CPU
correct_answer: Sourcing the correct keyboard layout and model
Avoiding ribbon cable crimping during installation

question_text: Select two reasons why a technician might prefer an external USB keyboard instead of replacing a faulty internal one immediately.
answer_options: The internal keyboard requires full motherboard replacement
USB keyboards can override BIOS passwords
Internal replacement may void warranty or require disassembly
USB keyboards improve typing accuracy on laptops
External keyboards allow functional testing before teardown
correct_answer: Internal replacement may void warranty or require disassembly
External keyboards allow functional testing before teardown

question_text: What is typically replaced when a single laptop key is damaged but the keyboard still works?
correct_answer: The keycap

question_text: Which of the following is a common cause of a damaged key on a laptop keyboard?
correct_answer: Physical impact or wear

question_text: Which of the following tools or items might be useful when replacing a single key on a laptop keyboard? (Select all that apply)
correct_answer: Replacement keycap
Flat plastic pry tool
Compressed air

question_text: Why is it important to consult the manufacturer's documentation before attempting a keycap replacement?
answer_options: Because keycaps are legally protected and cannot be removed
To avoid accidentally erasing BIOS settings
To prevent damaging the fragile keycap mountings
Because the key layout is usually randomized
correct_answer: To prevent damaging the fragile keycap mountings

question_text: Select two signs that a single key might be physically damaged.
answer_options: The key feels loose or tilted
Multiple keys stop working at once
The key doesn't register when pressed
correct_answer: The key feels loose or tilted
The key doesn't register when pressed

question_text: What is the role of the scissor mechanism in a laptop key?
answer_options: It connects the keyboard to the motherboard
It allows keycaps to be hot-swapped
It provides spring-back support and stability
It regulates power to the backlight
correct_answer: It provides spring-back support and stability

question_text: Why can improper removal of a laptop keycap result in permanent keyboard damage?
answer_options: It voids all device warranties instantly
Keycaps contain electrical fuses that break under force
The underlying scissor mechanism is delicate and may snap
It causes BIOS password lockout on modern laptops
correct_answer: The underlying scissor mechanism is delicate and may snap

question_text: Which of the following are valid troubleshooting steps before replacing a suspected damaged key? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: Test the key using an on-screen keyboard utility
Try compressed air to remove debris under the key
Compare with another identical laptop keyboard
Press multiple keys simultaneously to force reset
correct_answer: Test the key using an on-screen keyboard utility
Try compressed air to remove debris under the key
Compare with another identical laptop keyboard

question_text: Select two risks of replacing a single laptop key without proper tools or experience.
answer_options: Breaking the hinge or scissor mechanism beneath the key
correct_answer: Breaking the hinge or scissor mechanism beneath the key
Damaging adjacent keycaps during removal

question_text: What type of memory module is commonly used in laptops?
correct_answer: SODIMM

question_text: Which of the following indicates that a laptop's memory can be upgraded?
answer_options: RAM is soldered to the motherboard
Memory is embedded in the CPU
correct_answer: Laptop has accessible memory slots

question_text: What must you do to install a new memory module in a modular laptop?
answer_options: Remove the CPU and power supply
Access the RAM via a panel on the laptop bottom
correct_answer: Access the RAM via a panel on the laptop bottom
